patterns: What can you do for me

If you feel like this now you may not feel like this always, don't do something that hurts you permanently.

patterns: I keep waking up in the middle of the night
responses: What is causing you to be unable to sleep?
Sleep is important, but try not to stress about it or that will make it even harder to sleep.
Do something relaxing then try to fall asleep again.
If this is stress related, try to think about something else that is pleasant for you.

patterns: My roommates are being loud and I can't study
People are always loud in the hall
I can't concentrate because of noise
responses: Try asking whoever is being disruptive to stop, if that didn't work ask some authority to intervene
Try putting on some white noise to block it out

patterns: I am stressed out by a war.
I am so worried about an ongoing conflict.

responses: Things in the world are not your fault.
You can try to help by donating or spreading awareness.
Even if this is happening now, you should keep in mind that there are many positive events in the world as well.

patterns: My professors are not grading fairly
The faculty here are so unfair.
responses: Try to have empathy for your professor's point of view.
Try going to office hours and talking with them.
If you have a major issue, try seeing if other students are having the same thing.
Try speaking to the dean if you are having a major issue.

responses: Ahhh, I'm really sorry to hear that. I hope you're ok. I do really care about you. I want to help you more, but I think professionals could help you more than I. These people can help you: (607) 255-5155.
